name: Ext.tree.plugin.TreeViewDragDrop
doc:
This plugin provides drag and/or drop functionality for a TreeView.

It creates a specialized instance of DragZone which knows how to drag out of a TreeView and loads the data object which is passed to a cooperating DragZone's methods with the following properties:

  • copy : Boolean

    The value of the TreeView's copy property, or true if the TreeView was configured with allowCopy: true and the control key was pressed when the drag operation was begun.

  • view : TreeView

    The source TreeView from which the drag originated.

  • ddel : HTMLElement

    The drag proxy element which moves with the mouse

  • item : HTMLElement

    The TreeView node upon which the mousedown event was registered.

  • records : Array

    An Array of Models representing the selected data being dragged from the source TreeView.

It also creates a specialized instance of Ext.dd.DropZone which cooperates with other DropZones which are members of the same ddGroup which processes such data objects.

Adding this plugin to a view means that two new events may be fired from the client TreeView, beforedrop and drop.

Note that the plugin must be added to the tree view, not to the tree panel. For example using viewConfig:

viewConfig: {
    plugins: { ptype: 'treeviewdragdrop' }
}

members.name: allowContainerDrops
members.doc: True if drops on the tree container (outside of a specific tree node) are allowed.
members.short_doc: True if drops on the tree container (outside of a specific tree node) are allowed. ...

members.name: allowParentInserts
members.doc: Allow inserting a dragged node between an expanded parent node and its first child that will become a sibling of the parent when dropped.
members.short_doc:
Allow inserting a dragged node between an expanded parent node and its first child that will become a sibling of
the ...

members.name: appendOnly
members.doc: True if the tree should only allow append drops (use for trees which are sorted).
members.short_doc: True if the tree should only allow append drops (use for trees which are sorted). ...

members.name: containerScroll
members.doc: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations. A Ext.dd.ScrollManager configuration may also be passed.
members.short_doc: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations. ...

members.name: ddGroup
members.doc: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then both the DragZones and DropZone used by this plugin will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group.
members.short_doc: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. ...

members.name: displayField
members.doc: The name of the model field that is used to display the text for the nodes
members.short_doc: The name of the model field that is used to display the text for the nodes ...

members.name: dragGroup
members.doc:
The ddGroup to which the DragZone will belong.

This defines which other DropZones the DragZone will interact with. Drag/DropZones only interact with other Drag/DropZones which are members of the same ddGroup.
members.short_doc: The ddGroup to which the DragZone will belong. ...

members.name: dragText
members.doc:
The text to show while dragging.

Two placeholders can be used in the text:

  • {0} The number of selected items.
  • {1} 's' when more than 1 items (only useful for English).
members.short_doc: The text to show while dragging. ...

members.name: dragZone
members.doc:
A config object to apply to the creation of the DragZone which handles for drag start gestures.

Template methods of the DragZone may be overridden using this config.
members.short_doc: A config object to apply to the creation of the DragZone which handles for drag start gestures. ...

members.name: dropGroup
members.doc:
The ddGroup to which the DropZone will belong.

This defines which other DragZones the DropZone will interact with. Drag/DropZones only interact with other Drag/DropZones which are members of the same ddGroup.
members.short_doc: The ddGroup to which the DropZone will belong. ...

members.name: dropZone
members.doc:
A config object to apply to the creation of the DropZone which handles mouseover and drop gestures.

Template methods of the DropZone may be overridden using this config.
members.short_doc: A config object to apply to the creation of the DropZone which handles mouseover and drop gestures. ...

members.name: enableDrag
members.doc: Set to false to disallow dragging items from the View.
members.short_doc: Set to false to disallow dragging items from the View. ...

members.name: enableDrop
members.doc: Set to false to disallow the View from accepting drop gestures.
members.short_doc: Set to false to disallow the View from accepting drop gestures. ...

members.name: expandDelay
members.doc: The delay in milliseconds to wait before expanding a target tree node while dragging a droppable node over the target.
members.short_doc:
The delay in milliseconds to wait before expanding a target tree node while dragging a droppable node over the
target. ...

members.name: nodeHighlightColor
members.doc: The color to use when visually highlighting the dragged or dropped node (default value is light blue). The color must be a 6 digit hex value, without a preceding '#'. See also nodeHighlightOnDrop and nodeHighlightOnRepair.
members.short_doc: The color to use when visually highlighting the dragged or dropped node (default value is light blue). ...

members.name: nodeHighlightOnDrop
members.doc: Whether or not to highlight any nodes after they are successfully dropped on their target. Defaults to the value of Ext.enableFx. See also nodeHighlightColor and nodeHighlightOnRepair.
members.short_doc:
Whether or not to highlight any nodes after they are
successfully dropped on their target. ...

members.name: nodeHighlightOnRepair
members.doc: Whether or not to highlight any nodes after they are repaired from an unsuccessful drag/drop. Defaults to the value of Ext.enableFx. See also nodeHighlightColor and nodeHighlightOnDrop.
members.short_doc:
Whether or not to highlight any nodes after they are
repaired from an unsuccessful drag/drop. ...

members.name: sortOnDrop
members.doc: Configure as true to sort the target node into the current tree sort order after the dropped node is added.
members.short_doc: Configure as true to sort the target node into the current tree sort order after the dropped node is added. ...

members.name: dragZone
members.doc: An DragZone which handles mousedown and dragging of records from the grid.

members.name: dropZone
members.doc: An DropZone which handles mouseover and dropping records in any grid which shares the same dropGroup.

members.name: destroy
members.doc: Component calls destroy on all its plugins at destroy time.
members.short_doc: Component calls destroy on all its plugins at destroy time. ...

members.name: onViewRender
beforedrop
members.doc:
This event is fired through the TreeView. Add listeners to the TreeView object

Fired when a drop gesture has been triggered by a mouseup event in a valid drop position in the TreeView.

Returning false to this event signals that the drop gesture was invalid, and if the drag proxy will animate back to the point from which the drag began.

The dropHandlers parameter can be used to defer the processing of this event. For example to wait for the result of a message box confirmation or an asynchronous server call. See the details of this property for more information.

view.on('beforedrop', function(node, data, overModel, dropPosition, dropHandlers) {
    // Defer the handling
    dropHandlers.wait = true;
    Ext.MessageBox.confirm('Drop', 'Are you sure', function(btn){
        if (btn === 'yes') {
            dropHandlers.processDrop();
        } else {
            dropHandlers.cancelDrop();
        }
    });
});

Any other return value continues with the data transfer operation, unless the wait property is set.

params.name: node
params.doc: The TreeView node if any over which the mouse was positioned.

params.name: data
params.doc: The data object gathered at mousedown time by the cooperating DragZone's getDragData method it contains the following properties:

properties.name: copy
properties.doc: The value of the TreeView's copy property, or true if the TreeView was configured with allowCopy: true and the control key was pressed when the drag operation was begun

properties.name: view
properties.doc: The source TreeView from which the drag originated.

properties.name: ddel
properties.doc: The drag proxy element which moves with the mouse

properties.name: item
properties.doc: The TreeView node upon which the mousedown event was registered.

properties.name: records
properties.doc: An Array of Models representing the selected data being dragged from the source TreeView.

params.name: overModel
params.doc: The Model over which the drop gesture took place.

params.name: dropPosition
params.doc: "before", "after" or "append" depending on whether the mouse is above or below the midline of the node, or the node is a branch node which accepts new child nodes.

params.name: dropHandlers
params.doc: This parameter allows the developer to control when the drop action takes place. It is useful if any asynchronous processing needs to be completed before performing the drop. This object has the following properties:

properties.name: wait
properties.doc: Indicates whether the drop should be deferred. Set this property to true to defer the drop.

properties.name: processDrop
properties.doc: A function to be called to complete the drop operation.

properties.name: cancelDrop
properties.doc: A function to be called to cancel the drop operation.

members.short_doc: This event is fired through the TreeView. ...

members.name: drop
members.doc: This event is fired through the TreeView. Add listeners to the TreeView object Fired when a drop operation has been completed and the data has been moved or copied.

params.name: node
params.doc: The TreeView node if any over which the mouse was positioned.

params.name: data
params.doc: The data object gathered at mousedown time by the cooperating DragZone's getDragData method it contains the following properties:

properties.name: copy
properties.doc: The value of the TreeView's copy property, or true if the TreeView was configured with allowCopy: true and the control key was pressed when the drag operation was begun

properties.name: view
properties.doc: The source TreeView from which the drag originated.

properties.name: ddel
properties.doc: The drag proxy element which moves with the mouse

properties.name: item
properties.doc: The TreeView node upon which the mousedown event was registered.

properties.name: records
properties.doc: An Array of Models representing the selected data being dragged from the source TreeView.

params.name: overModel
params.doc: The Model over which the drop gesture took place.

params.name: dropPosition
params.doc: "before", "after" or "append" depending on whether the mouse is above or below the midline of the node, or the node is a branch node which accepts new child nodes.
